snippet: The recent discovery of unguarded vials of the smallpox virus at the National Institutes of Health points to the need for greater safety precautions.
abstract: Dr Lawrence K Altman The Doctor's World column observes that discovery of six glass vials of smallpox virus in storage room of National Institutes of Health in Bethesda, Md, has intensified debate over what to do with stockpiles of harmful microbes; some experts are calling for destruction of all such microbes, while others wish to store and study them.
lead_paragraph: The recent discovery of unguarded vials of the smallpox virus at the National Institutes of Health points to the need for greater safety precautions.

headline.main: Ticking Viral Bombs, Left in Boxes
